definition: to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies

sentences.english: Deception and deceptive, gradually became the most people.
sentences.chinese: 自欺與欺人，漸漸成了大多數人的愛好。

sentences.english: I think he is deluding himself, " said Ozel."
I feel very lucky, I still know, no self-deception life.
sentences.chinese: 我很慶幸，我還是知道了，沒有自欺欺人一生。

sentences.english: It is also an admonishment to people to not deceive themselves or others.
sentences.chinese: 並也告誡人們不要做自欺欺人的蠢事。

sentences.english: Putting it bluntly , this is dream talk.
sentences.chinese: 老實說罷，這是自欺欺人的夢話。

sentences.english: Let's suppose someone were dastardly enough to harbor such thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們設想有這麼個人可以自欺欺人地懷着這種想法。

sentences.english: You all do not stay, I again why a self-deception again.
sentences.chinese: 邇畢竟沒有一句挽留，我又何必再自欺欺人。

sentences.english: We often shed tear which deceive ourselves after deceive others.
sentences.chinese: 我們常常流淚，這會在欺人之後又復自欺。

sentences.english: Self-deceit will make him get lost in the forest of his own character.
sentences.chinese: 自欺欺人將使其自身迷失在自我品性的森林中。

sentences.english: I just hope I'm not deluding myself.
sentences.chinese: 我只是希望我沒有自欺欺人。

sentences.english: Let us not, I beseech you, sir, deceive ourselves longer.
sentences.chinese: 求求你，先生，我們不要再自欺欺人了。

sentences.english: But let’s not delude ourselves into thinking that final examinations will solve the problem.
sentences.chinese: 但不要自欺欺人的以爲僅憑期末考試就可以解決問題。

sentences.english: Let up then beware of self-deception.
sentences.chinese: 那就讓我們提防自欺行爲吧。

sentences.english: At last, in this magic moment, the veil of self-deceit is beginning to lift from my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 在那神奇的瞬間，自欺欺人的面紗從我眼前飄逝。

sentences.english: You are deceiving youself if you still believe that she loves you.
sentences.chinese: 你仍然相信她愛着你，那是在自欺欺人。

sentences.english: Veil of self-deceiving Blowin ' through my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 面紗的自欺欺人飄蕩通過我的眼睛“。

definition: to deceive others and to deceive oneself/to believe one's own lies
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to imagine that one's love is reciprocated/to shower affection on an uninterested party
to examine oneself/to reflect on one's shortcomings/introspection/self-awareness/self-criticism
lit. to cover one's ears whilst stealing a bell/to deceive oneself/to bury one's head in the sand (idiom)
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
